intro: Crocodeilanthe ovatipetala, commonly known as the broad-leafed bryophyte, is a rare and specialized member of the moss family. It is characterized by its thick, cushion-like growth form and dark green, ovate leaves that are often covered in a waxy cuticle. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its reproductive structures, including sporophytes, are embedded within the leafy mats, making them less visible. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
